articles.name: Service Incident - September 23rd, 2024
articles.title: Service Incident - September 23rd, 2024
articles.body:
SUMMARY

September 23, 2024 10:51 AM UTC | September 23, 2024 03:51 AM PT
We can confirm that customers are now able to update and create Leads again. We will mark this incident as resolved. Thank you for your patience during our investigation.

September 23, 2024 10:17 AM UTC | September 23, 2024 03:17 AM PT
We are currently investigating an issue that is causing customers being unable to create or update Leads in Sell, the ability to view Leads is not impacted. We will provide another update when we know more.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Why is the API step in Bot via the web widget failing to create tickets for new users?
articles.title: Why is the API step in Bot via the web widget failing to create tickets for new users?
articles.body:
Question

Why is the API step in the Bot web widget failing to create tickets for new users but working for existing users?

Answer

There is a permission error. The user in the API connection settings may have been downgraded to an agent role, allowing the current credentials to create tickets only for existing users.

To create tickets for new users, set up a new API connection with an Admin account. This will enable the API step to create tickets for new users.

 For more information, see this article: Using the Make API call step in a conversation bot

articles.name: Announcing the customizable CSAT experience
articles.title: Announcing the customizable CSAT experience
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
September 23, 2024 September 23, 2024 October 4, 2024

We are excited to announce that the customizable CSAT experience is now available for all eligible accounts. You can configure a CSAT survey that will be shared across both ticketing (Web form, Email, API) and messaging channels (social messaging, web/mobile messaging).

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What’s changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What's changing?

The customizable CSAT experience gives you better control over the end-user experience by allowing you to do the following:

  • Edit the survey question headlines to tailor them to your needs
  • Select a CSAT rating scale range with either 1-2, 1-3, or 1-5 scale increments
  • Select the rating type (numerical, emoji, or custom text) for CSAT questions
  • Remove dropdown and open-ended questions from your CSAT survey

The CSAT survey is delivered via automation and triggers. Once you activate CSAT channels, we create a default automation for ticketing channels and a default trigger for social channels.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

We are modernizing our CSAT solution to help you receive more accurate and relevant feedback about the state of your customer service. We intend to make more improvements to the CSAT in the future.

Shortly after GA we will release the following:

  • Public API for collecting actual survey results
  • Rating scales in email

What do I need to do?

You must have Support Pro or Suite Growth or higher plan to be eligible for the CSAT. You must also deactivate the Legacy CSAT before activating a new one.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

Read more about CSAT:

  • Customizing the CSAT end-user experience
  • Activating and deactivating the customizable CSAT survey
  • Reviewing the customizable CSAT results
  • Understanding the customizable CSAT end-user experience

articles.name: Do content cues evaluate searches from the Knowledge app?
articles.title: Do content cues evaluate searches from the Knowledge app?
articles.body:
Question

In Guide, do content cues consider searches performed in the Knowledge app? Is there a way to limit content cues to searches from that sidebar?

Answer

Yes, content cues take into consideration the topics being searched by your agents within the Knowledge app. Content cues cannot be filtered by search, the feature aggregates information from all of your tickets. For more information, see this article: Reviewing suggested support topics in Content Cues.

articles.name: I deleted a large number of steps in my conversation bot. Is there a way to undo this?
articles.title: I deleted a large number of steps in my conversation bot. Is there a way to undo this?
articles.body:
Question

I deleted a large number of steps in my conversation bot. Is there a way to undo this?

Answer

Once you delete the bot steps, you can't recover them. A notification advises you to copy the steps before deleting multiple ones:

It is strongly recommended that you copy these steps, as you cannot recover them after deletion.

For details on creating answers for your conversation bot, check out this article: Creating conversation bot answers for common customer questions

articles.name: Reviewing the customizable CSAT results
articles.title: Reviewing the customizable CSAT results
articles.body:
What's my plan?

You can view details about your customizable CSAT surveys through one of the following ways:

  • Zendesk Explore dashboard
  • Zendesk QA dashboard and tickets
  • Agent Workspace

To receive results, you must have enabled customer satisfaction ratings and received at least one response. See Customizing the CSAT end-user experience.

This article includes the following topics:
  • Zendesk Explore
  • Zendesk QA
  • Agent Workspace
Related articles
  • Customizing the CSAT end-user experience
  • Activating and deactivating the customizable CSAT survey
  • Understanding the customizable CSAT end-user experience

Zendesk Explore

Zendesk Explore offers you a comprehensive view of CSAT results. You can use the Satisfaction tab of the Zendesk Support dashboard to view details about your CSAT surveys in Explore. See Viewing your CSAT (customer satisfaction) score and ratings.

The Good/Bad scale is mapped to the configured numerical rating scales for the CSAT. For example, for:

  • 1-2 rating scales, 1 is bad and 2 is good
  • 1-3 rating scales, 1-2 is bad, and 3 is good
  • 1-5 rating scales, 1-3 is bad, and 4-5 is good

Zendesk QA

With Zendesk QA, you can access a more granular view of your data. You can use the Surveys Dashboard in Zendesk QA to view and analyze the results of your surveys. The Surveys dashboard provides a CSAT card to help you understand your survey results. See Using the surveys dashboard.

Agent Workspace

You can view the CSAT rating in the upper bar of the ticket in Agent Workspace. To view responses to drop-down and open-ended questions, click Events, then scroll to the relevant event.

articles.name: Understanding the customizable CSAT end-user experience
articles.title: Understanding the customizable CSAT end-user experience
articles.body:
What's my plan?

The end-user experience for customers receiving the CSAT varies depending on the channel used to issue the survey. CSAT surveys can be sent via one of the following channels:
  • Ticketing channel: End users receive emails asking them to rate their experience once their ticket is solved.
  • Messaging: End users receive a request to evaluate their experience in the messaging channel when their ticket is solved.
  • Request page: Once their ticket is solved, end users can use the Requests page to find and open their request, where they can share and submit their feedback

The sections in this article describe the CSAT end user experience for the default automation in each supported channel. If you are not using the default automation, your end user experience may vary.

This article includes the following topics:
  • Ticketing channel experience
  • Messaging experience
  • Request page experience
Related articles
  • Customizing the CSAT end-user experience
  • Activating and deactivating the customizable CSAT survey
  • Reviewing the customizable CSAT results

Ticketing channel experience

When you turn on CSAT ratings in Zendesk Support, end users who submitted their request via email receive a notification after the ticket has been set to solved, asking them to briefly evaluate their experience. They have 28 days to respond to this request. However, responses will not be recorded after the ticket is closed. You can customize the default automation to modify the end-user experience, including the number of hours after users receive a notification.

The survey is designed to maximize the response rate by being quick and simple while also gathering the essential data: a positive or negative rating and optional comments.

When users click Share feedback, they are brought to a landing page where they can provide their feedback and add comments. The elements end users see on the landing page depends on how the CSAT was configured. For example, if the CSAT was configured to include the CSAT ratings and no additional questions, end users would only see the ratings area. For all of the possible configuration elements, see Using the customizable CSAT experience.

Example

In this example, a CSAT survey is configured with the following:

  • CSAT question with ratings
  • Drop down reasons for users who submit a negative ratings
  • Open ended question

When CSAT is configured this way, end users responding to the survey will see one of the following views, depending on whether they submit a positive or a negative rating.

  • Positive rating: End users can add comments

  • Negative rating: End users can add comments and select a reason for their experience from the drop-down menu.

Messaging experience

You can collect customer feedback through web and social messaging channels. To send your survey via a messaging channel, you must have the messaging channel configured on your account. See Getting started with social messaging and Setting up Web Widget to add messaging to your website or help center

When you turn on CSAT ratings in Zendesk Support, after an end user receives assistance through a messaging channel, they are sent a message asking them to evaluate their experience. You can customize the default trigger to modify the end user experience. See Managing ticket triggers.

By default, the survey is opened in the messaging channels (for example, web and mobile). The survey is designed to maximize the response rate by being quick and simple, while also gathering the essential data: a positive or negative rating and optional comments.

When users click Submit rating, they begin a messaging conversation that guides them through questions where they can provide their feedback and add comments. This flow may vary based on the messaging channel and configuration. In addition, in some social messaging channels, you'll see a link instead of a Submit rating button. In general, the elements end users can respond to in the message depends on how the CSAT was configured. For example, if the CSAT was configured to include the CSAT ratings and no additional questions, end users would only see the ratings question. For all of the possible configuration elements, see Setting up the CSAT survey earlier in this article.

In this example, a CSAT survey is configured with the following:
  • CSAT question with ratings
  • Drop down reasons for users who submit a negative rating
  • Open ended question
When CSAT is configured this way, end users responding to the survey would see the following flow. This example shows the screens and fields that appear when a user submits a negative rating.
  • Rating: User rates the support as 3, which is a negative rating.

  • Reason: User selects a reason for their experience from the drop-down menu.

  • Comments and submit: User finishes the survey by typing additional comments and then clicking Submit feedback.

Request page experience

You can use CSAT to collect feedback from end users via the request page. To do this, your theme must include the new satisfaction_response property in the Copenhagen request_page.hbs. If you are using:

  • The standard Copenhagen theme, your theme was automatically updated to include this property.
  • A custom theme, you can update your theme to incorporate the new code that supports this feature, available in the templating API v3 and above. For an example of this code, see the Copenhagen theme request page.hbs on GitHub

Once the ticket is solved, end users can use the Requests page to find and open their request. They can then click Add feedback to open the CSAT survey, where they can share and submit their feedback.

If end users return to the Request page after submitting their feedback, they can click the Edit feedback link to view or change their submitted feedback.

If the time allocated to the CSAT resolution has passed, end users will only be able to access a link to View feedback, where they can see what they submitted, but cannot change their response.

articles.name: Activating and deactivating the customizable CSAT survey
articles.title: Activating and deactivating the customizable CSAT survey
articles.body:
What's my plan?

When you create a new CSAT survey that you want to send to customers, you can activate the CSAT channels (for example, email, social messaging, or web/mobile messaging) to create the default automation and triggers that support that survey. You can then update and view the automation rules associated with that channel.
Important: Before you activate a CSAT survey, you must deactivate the legacy CSAT survey and accompanying automation and triggers. See Activating a CSAT channel below for more information.
This article includes the following topics:
  • Activating a CSAT channel
  • Deactivating a CSAT channel
  • Turning off the customizable CSAT survey
  • Updating and viewing automation rules
Related articles
  • Customizing the CSAT end-user experience
  • Understanding the customizable CSAT end-user experience
  • Reviewing the customizable CSAT results

Activating a CSAT channel

Activating a channel turns on the CSAT survey for end users. Before activating the new CSAT survey's accompanying automation and triggers, you must manually deactivate the custom automations and triggers that have the placeholders {{satisfaction.rating_section}} or {{satisfaction.rating_url}} or that have the "Request messaging rating" action. See the information about legacy placeholders in Zendesk Support placeholders reference. See also Customizing your customer satisfaction survey.

To activate a CSAT channel
  1. If you haven't already, open the CSAT survey you just saved.
  2. In the Channels section, click the channel actions icon () for the channel you want to activate, then select Activate.
    Note: Custom CSAT automations and triggers are not displayed in this section.

  3. Click Activate rule.

    Once you activate the rule, the channel Status will show as Active on the Customer satisfaction page.

Deactivating a CSAT channel

Deactivating a channel removes the channel and accompanying automations, but leaves the CSAT survey intact.

To deactivate a CSAT channel
  1. In Admin Center, click Objects and rules in the sidebar, then select Business rules > Customer satisfaction.
  2. In the Channels section, click the channel actions icon () for the channel you want to deactivate, then select Deactivate.

  3. Click Deactivate rule.

    The channel is deactivated. The channel status is set to Inactive on the Customer satisfaction page.

Turning off the customizable CSAT survey

Turning off a CSAT survey removes the CSAT survey and deactivates all channels.

To turn off the CSAT survey and deactivate all channels
  1. In Admin Center, click Objects and rules in the sidebar, then select Business rules > Customer satisfaction.
  2. Click Turn off.

  3. Click Turn off.

    When you turn off the survey, you will be redirected to the landing page, where you can set up a new CSAT survey.

Updating and viewing automation rules

When you activate the CSAT channel, new default triggers and automation rules are created to support the new CSAT experience. Activating an email channel creates a default automation; activating a messaging channel creates a default trigger.

To view the rules for your activated channel, you can click the channel actions icon () for the channel that you want to view, then select View rule.

Email automation rules

When you click View rule on the email channel, a new tab opens displaying the Business rules > Automations page. You can use this page to update the automation rule or configure your own using the {{satisfaction.survey_section}} and {{satisfaction.survey_url}} placeholders.

Messaging triggers

When you click View rule on the messaging channel, a new tab opens displaying the Business rules > Triggers page. You can use this page to update the trigger for social messaging channels, and web and mobile channels.

articles.name: Join us on September 26 for an our next Community Event on AI-Powered Messaging Event!
articles.title: Join us on September 26 for an our next Community Event on AI-Powered Messaging Event!
articles.body:
Discover how you can transform your customer service from chat to Zendesk AI-powered Messaging at our next Community Event.

This session will guide you through the journey of enhancing your customer communication capabilities step-by-step by leveraging AI and machine learning. Explore Zendesk’s AI-Powered Messaging and see how it allows you to automate interactions, offer 24/7 support, and personalize customer experiences.

Seamlessly integrate this powerful tool across multiple channels such as web, mobile, and social media, ensuring a consistent and unified service experience. Additionally, we'll showcase how to leverage real-time analytics to gain valuable insights into customer interactions and improve support performance.

Sign up today to lock in your spot and have your registration questions answered during our live Q&A session.

articles.name: How can I chose which page the bot appears on?
articles.title: How can I chose which page the bot appears on?
articles.body:
Question

Can I decide which page of my website the bot shows? And how does the bot interfere with messaging?

Answer

The bot lives within messaging and its Web Widget. Choose where the web widget will show, by applying the widget code to the source code of headers of specific pages of your website.

Note: This article is provided for instructional purposes only. Zendesk can't provide support for the source code of your own website.

For more information, see these articles:

  • Getting started with messaging for your website, help center, and mobile apps
  • Creating a conversation bot for your web and mobile channels
  • Creating conversation bot answers for common customer questions

articles.name: Does the API job contribute to the per-minute rate limit?
articles.title: Does the API job contribute to the per-minute rate limit?
articles.body:
Question

Does the API job contribute to the per-minute rate limit?

Answer

The job limit is specific to each endpoint. For instance, with a limit of 700 calls and 30 jobs, you can only make 30 job calls until the count resets. If you request 30 jobs in a minute, that's 30 API calls, leaving you with 670 calls remaining to hit the limit. You can still use other API endpoints until you reach the 700 call limit.

For more information, check our API documentation: Rate limits

articles.name: Service Incident - September 19th, 2024
articles.title: Service Incident - September 19th, 2024
articles.body:
SUMMARY

September 19, 2024 01:23 PM UTC | September 19, 2024 06:23 AM PT
The authentication issues affecting multiple products and Pods, which specifically caused “This page isn’t working” and HTTP Error 500 messages for customers accessing Zendesk Explore, have been fully resolved. Customers should no longer experience any errors, and normal functionality has been restored. Thank you again for your patience during this time.

September 19, 2024 09:36 AM UTC | September 19, 2024 02:36 AM PT
While our team is actively working to fully resolve the problem and has implemented a potential fix, we are seeing an initial improvement with a decrease in errors. We will continue to monitor the situation and keep you updated with any further developments. Thank you for your patience.

September 19, 2024 09:02 AM UTC | September 19, 2024 02:02 AM PT
We are currently experiencing authentication issues that are affecting multiple products and Pods, including Chat, Talk, Support, and Explore. Our team is actively investigating the problem, and we will provide more information as soon as we have further details. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Error: One or more intents are not available any more
articles.title: Error: One or more intents are not available any more
articles.body:
Issue symptoms

When I create answers in my conversation bot, I see this error: One or more intents are not available any more. Remove them.

Resolution steps

To fix the error One or more intents are not available any more:

  • Since you created the answer, the selected intent might not exist anymore
    • If the corresponding intent is missing from the Intents tab, remove it
  • Add a schedule in your account and set it as a condition of business hours to the flow of your answer

articles.name: How to update your Zendesk help center profile
articles.title: How to update your Zendesk help center profile
articles.body:
Our Zendesk Help Center is more than just a support platform—it's a space for our community to connect, interact, and help each other out. Personalizing your profile on the help center is a way to express your identity within our community. It allows other members to recognize you, strengthens relationships, and fosters better communication. 

Keeping your profile updated also ensures that any assistance or responses provided are better suited to your needs. These steps are here to guide you on how to update and make edits to your profile in the Zendesk Help Center.

 

To personalize your profile

  1. Access your user profile by clicking on your profile name/icon at the top right corner of the page and then selecting My profile.


  2. On your profile page, click Edit profile.


  3. After you select Edit profile, you will see a pop-up to edit your profile. You can update the following information:
    • Name
    • Profile photo
    • Email
    • Phone
    • Two-factor authentication
    • Description


Once you’re happy with these changes, click the OK button.


That's it! You've now successfully updated your profile in our Zendesk Help Center.

articles.name: How can I see if semantic search is enabled in our account?
articles.title: How can I see if semantic search is enabled in our account?
articles.body:
Question

How can I see if semantic search is enabled in our account? When will we get it in our help center?

Answer

The rollout status of the semantic search is based on the content type, search type, and language of your help center, and the search channel. Although there aren't official dates for a release, you can review its current status:

  1. Confirm if semantic search is enabled in your help center.
  2. If it is not enabled, review this rollout plan for more information. This plan classifies the coverage status of each feature in covered, planned, not planned and will not be supported.

articles.name: How can I identify the user or create a ticket for an unresolved conversation?
articles.title: How can I identify the user or create a ticket for an unresolved conversation?
articles.body:
Question

I reviewed bot conversation transcripts but want additional information about the user involved in an unresolved conversation. How can I identify the user or create a ticket for an unresolved conversation?

Answer

It's not possible to extract user-specific data from unresolved bot sessions. The transcript is designed to offer insights into the user interactions with the bot. The information in the transcript should help you identify knowledge gaps and areas for improvement.

Conversation transcripts aren't intended to supply specific user information for the purpose of proactive outreach. The focus of improvement areas to help with automated resolutions does not rely on user details. Instead, it's encouraged that you review the conversation transcripts, then optimize your articles and conversation flows or send a feedback to Zendesk on automated resolutions to improve your users' experience with AI agents.

For more information, see the article: About automated resolutions for AI agents.

articles.name: How to create a new post in the Zendesk community
articles.title: How to create a new post in the Zendesk community
articles.body:
We recognize that many of you have valuable insights, best practices, and questions you'd like to share. That's why we're happy to present this handy step by step guide on creating a new post in our Zendesk community.

Note: Before you can create a post, you need to have a Zendesk Help Center account. See: How to sign up in our Zendesk Help Center

To create a post in the Zendesk community

  1. Go to our Zendesk Help Center
  2. Click on Sign In at the top right and log in with your Zendesk Help Center credentials.

    Note: These credentials may be different from what you use to log into your own Zendesk subdomain.

  3. Select Community from the top navigation bar.


  4. From the topic landing page, select a topic you’d like to create a post in.. Click See All to view all our topics within a section.


  5. Once you’re in the desired topic (eg Quality Assurance), click New Post.


  6. In the new post form, enter the Title and Details of your post.

    Note: It’s important to have a clear and concise title as that’s the first thing our community members will see before clicking into the post.

    When filling out the Details section, aim to provide comprehensive and clear information relevant to your Title. This will allow Zendesk and the community to better assist you and to fully engage with your questions, feedback, or discussions. Feel free to include screenshots in your posts to provide visual context.



    Since this is a public community, please don't include any Personally Identifiable Information (information that can identify individuals) in your posts/comments.
  7. When you are satisfied with your post draft, click New Post to publish to the Zendesk community.


    Note: Remember, you can always edit or delete your posts later if you make a mistake or want to update it.

Congratulations! You have created a new post within the Zendesk community! Your contributions greatly enrich our shared knowledge and are what make our community thrive. Thank you and welcome to the Zendesk community!

Note: Zendesk community promotes respectful and helpful discussions. Ensure you adhere to the Zendesk Community Code of Conduct and respect all members. Avoid posting material that could be considered offensive or proprietary in nature.

articles.name: Release notes through 2024-09-13
articles.title: Release notes through 2024-09-13
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released in the last month.

This week's release notes include:

    • AI agents (formerly bots)
    • App Marketplace
    • Products with no updates this week

AI agents (formerly bots)

Fixed

  • Optimised handling high conversation loads to improve data load performance in the Insights dashboard.
  •  

App Marketplace

New
  • Ticket Parser Autofill (Support)
    • Ticket Parser Autofill automatically extracts data from ticket comments and auto-fills fields.  Automatically identify and extract key information such as order numbers, customer names, product details, and more from ticket comments.  Save time and minimize errors by automatically filling extracted data into the relevant ticket fields without manual intervention.  Easily set up and modify parsing rules tailored to your specific needs without needing complex regular expressions.
  • Onoff Business (Support)
    • Onoff Business is an innovative professional mobile communication for companies of all sizes. There is no need for a second device, SIM card, or another mobile contract to provide mobile numbers to your employees.  Automatically create support tickets for calls, voicemails, and SMS messages within your Zendesk Support account.  Quickly access customer information from Zendesk Support directly on your Onoff Business contact page, making communication management seamless and efficient. Export and import contacts between Zendesk Support and Onoff Business, ensuring that your customer data is always up-to-date.
  • SyncHub (Support)
    • SyncHub connects your Zendesk account to Power BI, Tableau, Excel, G-Sheets, or your favorite reporting tool, allowing you to build custom reports or integrate with your existing BI dashboards.  SyncHub works by querying the Zendesk API for changes to your data and then incrementally storing those changes in a reporting database. Choose from 50+ connectors to connect other cloud services you use, then build aggregate reports across your entire business. 
  • Tangle (Support)
    • Tangle makes it easy to keep track of all your customer emails. No matter where they are or what system sent them, Tangle stores them all. No more guessing what an email looks like, where to find it, and how to resend it if a customer asks.  Connect Tangle with Zendesk and quickly view the Tangle app in the ticket sidebar along with the email history with the ticket requester.  View, resend, or forward an email directly from the app while working on a ticket.
  • vennie (Support)
    • vennie is the ideal solution for German eCommerce businesses aiming to streamline customer support through automation. Launched in 2024, Vennie uses AI-driven decisions and industry best practices to manage ticket responses and the entire support process. With exceptional German language support, GDPR compliance, and powerful features like updating customer or order data directly through the shop's CMS, vennie pushes the boundaries of automation. 
  • Tixo 128 (Theme)
    • Tixo 128 transforms your customer support with a stylish Zendesk theme that combines eye-catching design with powerful features. Enjoy customizable blocks and actionable prompts that make branding effortless, allowing you to set up a stunning help center without coding skills while enhancing the customer experience.
  • Merge Ticket by New Aim (Support)
    • Merge Ticket by New Aim enhances workflow efficiency by automatically merging related tickets based on predefined rules. This app automatically merges tickets from the same brand and requester with the same subject, reducing the workload and minimizing human errors. Depending on the customer, an ongoing email conversation might come through as a new ticket. This app takes care of that for you, reducing your headache and keeping your support process smooth and efficient.
  • ClickSend SMS (Support)
    • ClickSend SMS allows you to send and receive text messages seamlessly within Zendesk, enhancing your customer support capabilities globally.  Create customizable SMS templates to streamline workflows, send texts to thousands of customers, schedule messages to send on specific times and dates, and more.
  • Relay.app (Support)
    • Relay.app helps you integrate Zendesk with your other apps, from Jira, Google Workspace, Notion, and more. Coordinate across apps and automatically keep data up-to-date where you need it and when you need it. Build your first Relay.app workflow in minutes.
  • Google Admin Pro by SaaS Aid (Support) (paid)
    • Google Admin Pro by Saas Aid helps you solve your everyday IT support requests quickly and efficiently by managing Google Workspace user accounts directly from the Zendesk ticket interface.  Reset account passwords, reset two-step verification, log out users from web sessions, wipe all Oauth tokens, suspend and unsuspend accounts, and more/

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Explore
  • Talk
  • Guide and machine learning
  • Chat and messaging
  • Mobile SDKs
  • Chat and messaging
  • Admin Center
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: How can I prevent customers from solving their tickets?
articles.title: How can I prevent customers from solving their tickets?
articles.body:
Question

From my contact form and article suggestions, customers are able to solve their own ticket. How can I prevent my end users from closing their ticket?

Answer

You can prevent your users from solving tickets, by following either of these steps:

  • Create a trigger to automatically re-open the tickets solved by your end users
  • Otherwise, remove article suggestions by unticking Web form channel enabled

articles.name: Service Incident - September 16th, 2024
articles.title: Service Incident - September 16th, 2024
articles.body:
SUMMARY

September 16, 2024 10:37 AM UTC | September 16, 2024 03:37 AM PT
We are pleased to inform you that the recent service disruption has been fully resolved and all affected services are now fully operational. We appreciate your patience and understanding throughout this incident.

September 16, 2024 06:36 AM UTC | September 15, 2024 11:36 PM PT
Our content delivery partner has implemented a fix, and we have reports confirming recovery from some customers. We will continue to monitor and will provide the next update upon full recovery.

September 16, 2024 05:59 AM UTC | September 15, 2024 10:59 PM PT
Whilst our content delivery provider is still working on the fix, we are are no longer able to reproduce previous errors. Please refresh your Zendesk instance and let us know if you are seeing any improvements. We continue to work with our CDN provider and will provide another update in 30 minutes.

September 16, 2024 05:33 AM UTC | September 15, 2024 10:33 PM PT
Our content delivery provider has identified an issue causing elevated errors at their end and they are implementing a fix. We are continuing to work with them and will provide another update in 30 minutes or when we have more to share.

September 16, 2024 05:12 AM UTC | September 15, 2024 10:12 PM PT
We are aware of an issue that may causing symptoms with customers not being able to login, latencies accessing various parts of the Zendesk product, or API calls failing. We are reaching out to our content delivery provider and are working with them. More information in the next 30 minutes.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Messaging triggers conditions and actions reference
articles.title: Messaging triggers conditions and actions reference
articles.body:
What's my plan?

Zendesk messaging triggers allow you to send messages to customers, optimize your workflow, and re-engage with the customer.

Note: Some of the elements described in this article are only available on accounts using the improved messaging backend.

This article contains the following tables:

  • Trigger firing events
  • Trigger operators
  • Trigger conditions
  • Trigger actions
  • Trigger placeholders

Related articles:

  • About messaging triggers in Admin Center
  • Working with messaging triggers in Admin Center

Trigger firing events

Every trigger starts with a firing event. These events dictate whether the trigger will run, then evaluate its conditions and fire its specified actions. Use the Run trigger dropdown to choose a trigger’s firing events.

Note: Messaging tickets are created when a conversation bot hands over control of a messaging conversation.
  • When a customer requests a conversation: The trigger runs when a Conversation is handed over from the bot and a ticket is created.
  • When a message is sent: The trigger runs when a customer enters and sends a message in the messaging Web Widget.
  • When conversation is added to the queue: The trigger runs when a messaging conversation is placed in the queue. Requires the improved messaging backend..
  • When conversation is assigned from a queue: The trigger runs when a messaging ticket is assigned to an agent from the queue, via the Accept button or auto-accept. It does activate the trigger when an agent reassigns the ticket to another agent, or when the agent claims the ticket from a group view. Requires the improved messaging backend.

Trigger operators

Use the following operators to build trigger condition statements.

Table 1. Trigger operators
Operator Description
is Exact match
= 5 returns true only when 5
Less than Less than the number entered, but not including
< 10 returns true from 0-9
Greater than More than the number entered
> 120 returns true from 121 to 1,000,000,000,000,000,000
Less than or equal to An exact match or less than the number entered
<= 3 returns true on a 3, 2, 1, or 0
Greater than or equal to An exact match or more than the number entered
>= 600 returns true from 600 to 1,000,000,000,000,000
Is not Anything but the value entered
!= 0 returns true for any number but 0
Contains String includes the following text 
"help" matches true with "help, i need somebody"
Contains (case sensitive) String includes the following text 
"Hello" matches with "Hello, it's me"
Does not contain String does not include the following text
"help" matches true with "not just anybody"
Reg Ex Matches for regular expression values using the Python RegEx framework. This field looks for a full match, not a partial. For assistance, you can use Pythex as a quick reference and validation tool.
(?P<year>(?:19|20)\d\d)(?P<delimiter>[- /.])(?P<month>0[1-9]|1[012])\2(?P<day>0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])
Test String:  2014-07-28
String match:  2014-07-28
Reg Ex Field looks for a full case-sensitive match, not a partial match.

Trigger conditions

Condition statements are collections of conditions, field operators, and condition values. Available values can vary based on the condition selected. Condition statements are essentially ‘if’ statements that return all tickets that meet the specified criteria.

You must select one – and only one – of the condition statements to save and use a trigger in both the Visual and Developer views:

  • Check All of the Following Conditions requires all conditions to be met to execute a trigger’s actions.

  • Check Any of the Following Conditions requires only one condition to be met to execute a trigger’s actions.

Note: Zendesk has implemented limits on certain trigger conditions. Any existing triggers that exceed these limits will be disabled. If you attempt to re-enable them, an error message will appear. The table below includes these condition limits.
Table 2. Trigger conditions
Condition Description
Date and time
Hour of day Hour of the day (Universal Time Clock):

0 = Midnight

23 = 11 p.m.

Note that the Hour of day condition uses the hour only, and does not include minutes.
Day of week Day of the Week:

0 = Monday

6 = Sunday
Previous conversation
Customer previous conversations Number of times the customer has previously had a conversation with an agent. (New conversation = 0)
Customer Information
Customer name Name of customer
Customer triggered

Triggered customer (activated by Set triggered action).

Values are True or False

Online Status
Account Status Status of your Zendesk account. Values are:
  • Online: If at least one agent is online and the rest are away or offline, then the account status is Online and the trigger fires.
  • Away: If at least one agent is away and the rest are offline, the account status is Away and the trigger fires.
  • Offline: If all agents are offline, the account status is Offline and the trigger fires.
Group Status

Status of the selected Zendesk group. Values are:

  • Online: If at least one agent in the group is online, and the rest are away or offline, then the group status is Online, and the trigger fires.
  • Away: If at least one agents in a group is away, and the rest are offline, the group status is Away and the trigger fires.
  • Offline: If all agents in a group are offline, the group status is Offline, and the trigger fires.
Conversation-related information
Customer is active in the conversation True if the customer is currently engaged in a conversation.
Customer is requesting conversation

Values are:

  • True if the customer is requesting to start a conversation.
  • False if no agent has responded to the customer.
Customer is served

Values are:

  • True if the customer is actively being assisted by an agent (for example, the agent has accepted the conversation and sent an initial message).
  • False if no agent has responded to the customer.
Group Group (name) assigned to the conversation.
Sender Name of the message sender.
Sender Type Values are Agent or Customer.
Message The message being sent.
Initial routing

The conversation is added to a queue for the first time, and applies only to tickets with the New ticket status. Does not apply to tickets that are transferred from one group or agent queue to another.

This condition can be used to differentiate between the messaging tickets added to the queue for the first time and tickets transferred to the queue.

Values are:

  • True if the messaging ticket is added to the queue for the first time.
  • False if the ticket is transferred from another queue, or if the ticket is sent to an overflow queue.

Requires the improved messaging backend.
Customer queue
Queue Size
The total number of incoming conversation requests for the account.
Note: This condition targets the overall account queue, not the department-specific queue.

Trigger actions

Action statements define what occurs if all the condition statements are true and the trigger fires. You can think of action statements as ‘then’ statements: if all of your conditions are true, then perform these actions to execute these actions to update the conversation.

Table 3. Trigger actions
Action Description
Send message to customer Sends a predefined message to the user.
Wait Introduces a delay before the next action is fired.
Note: Triggers are run simultaneously. If multiple triggers need to be fired in a specific sequence, add at least a one-second delay to each subsequent trigger.
Request email Sends an automated message to the customer requesting their email to facilitate continuous conversation re-engagement.
Set triggered

Applies a flag that can be used with the Customer triggered condition. Values are: True or False

Note: If the account is Offline, this action will not work.
Add tag Adds a tag to the ticket.

Trigger placeholders

Placeholders are references to visitor details you can use in trigger action statements. When the trigger is fired, the placeholder pulls in the current visitor and session information.

Table 4. Trigger placeholders
Placeholder Type Description
@hour_of_day Integer Current hour of the day (UTC timezone). 0 - 23
@day_of_week Integer Current day of the week (0 = Monday, 6 = Sunday)
@customer_prev_conversations Integer Number of previous independent conversations initiated with agent (New conversation = 0)
@customer_name String Name of the customer
@customer_triggered String True if the customer has previously received a messaging trigger.
@account_status String Status of the account (Online, Away, or Offline)
@groupStatus String Status of the Group (Online, Away, or Offline)
@customer_is_in_active_conversation String True if the customer is active in the conversation.
@customer_requesting_conversation String True if the customer is requesting a conversation.
@customer_served String True if customer is currently being served by an agent.
@sender String The name of the sender.
@sender_type String The type of sender (Agent or Customer)
@message String The message sent.
@queue_size Integer The incoming conversation requests
@wait_time_min Integer Minimum estimated wait time for the first response from an agent to the ticket (in minutes). Estimation requires data. The wait time is available only for groups with at least 1 ticket routed in the last 7 days. Requires the improved messaging backend.
@wait_time_max Integer Maximum estimated wait time for the first response from an agent to the ticket (in minutes). Estimation requires data. The wait time is available only for groups with at least 1 ticket routed in the last 7 days. Requires the improved messaging backend.

articles.name: Zendesk Salesforce Integration error: STRING_TOO_LONG :: Description: data value too large
articles.title: Zendesk Salesforce Integration error: STRING_TOO_LONG :: Description: data value too large
articles.body:
Question

Why is ticket sync failing with an error in the Zendesk Salesforce integration?

Ticket ID 123456 failed to sync :: STRING_TOO_LONG :: Description: data value too large 

Answer

By default, the body description of a Zendesk ticket is synced with the Salesforce case body, which is a rich content text field. However, Salesforce currently limits this field to 32,000 characters.

There is no workaround at present, but you can consider the following:

  1. Open a case with the Salesforce Support team and inquire about increasing the character limit for the standard Case "Description" long text area field.
  2. Avoid creating tickets with more than 32,000 characters in the description. You can also recreate the ticket for the end user with less than 32,000 characters if a long thread was added to a short reply.

For more information, refer to this Salesforce article: The default limit on Long Text Area fields is 32,768 characters.

articles.name: Service Incident - September 13th, 2024
articles.title: Service Incident - September 13th, 2024
articles.body:
SUMMARY

September 13, 2024 05:24 PM UTC | September 13, 2024 10:24 AM PT
We are happy to report that the issue affecting inbound emails through the Gmail connector has been resolved, and incoming emails are being processed without delays. Thank you for your patience during our investigation.

September 13, 2024 04:45 PM UTC | September 13, 2024 09:45 AM PT
We are seeing improvement in the issue causing delays and blocked emails for customers using the Gmail connector. We will continue to monitor the situation until full recovery.

September 13, 2024 03:49 PM UTC | September 13, 2024 08:49 AM PT
We are aware of an issue that is causing delays and potentially preventing incoming emails for customers using the Gmail connector. We are working with our vendor to resolve the issue and will provide further updates when we have new information to share.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

articles.name: Why doesn't the Copenhagen theme get updates?
articles.title: Why doesn't the Copenhagen theme get updates?
articles.body:
Question

What is the reason the Copenhagen theme is not receiving updates?

Answer

If the Copenhagen theme isn't updating, it may be due to custom modifications made to its code. Once a theme is altered, it's considered a custom theme, which won't receive automatic updates, as changes might conflict with your custom setup. For more information, see this article: Using the standard Copenhagen theme in your help center.

articles.name: Displaying estimated wait time in messaging conversations
articles.title: Displaying estimated wait time in messaging conversations
articles.body:
Admins can set up messaging triggers to share an estimated wait time with customers for agent engagement. Estimated wait time is calculated and displayed after a conversation bot hands off a messaging conversation and a ticket is created. Wait time is estimated based on the ticket’s position in the ticket queue using recent ticketing data. Admins can also set up triggers to send a message to the customer after the messaging ticket is assigned to an agent from a queue.

Note: Some of the elements described in this article are only available on accounts using the improved messaging backend.

This article includes the following sections:

  • About estimated wait time in messaging conversations
  • Displaying estimated wait time
  • Sending a follow-up message when a ticket is assigned to an agent

Related article:

  • Messaging triggers conditions and actions reference

About estimated wait time in messaging conversations

Wait time is estimated using a statistical model that considers the average wait time for the customer's queue position and historical wait time only for that queue or group. The model pulls performance data from the most recent period available: the previous 10 minutes, two hours, or three weeks.

Estimation requires data. The wait time will be available only for queues/groups with at least 1 ticket routed in the last 7 days. The trigger(s) will not be activated with insufficient data.

On third-party bots, the trigger is activated after the bot hands over control, and the created ticket is placed in the queue.

The following situations may impact the accuracy of wait time estimates:

  • A surge in ticket submissions. Accuracy will increase as more new data is available.

  • Insufficient recent ticket data.

  • Queues that recently came online.

  • Queues with irregular wait times due to insufficient agent capacity or a lack of agent availability.

Displaying estimated wait time

To display the estimated wait time to a customer, you must build a trigger that runs only when a conversation is initially added to the queue and sends a message to the customer using the @wait_time_min and @wait_time_max placeholders.

Applying this trigger to a small agent group or customer segment is recommended to ensure it functions as expected before rolling it out to your entire team.

Consider communicating clearly to your customers that estimated wait times are just that – estimates – and are not guaranteed (“Expect to wait at least @wait_time_min minutes” or "We should be with you within @wait_time_max minutes," for example).

To display an estimated wait time

  1. In Admin Center, click Objects and rules in the sidebar, then select Business rules > Messaging triggers.
  2. Click Create trigger.
  3. Enter a name and brief description for your trigger.
  4. Click Activate this trigger.
  5. Customize the trigger as follows:
    • Run trigger: When a conversation is added to the queue.
    • Conditions: Match ALL of the following conditions:
      • Initial routing | is | True
      • Group | is | <group name>
      • Group status | <group name> | Online
    • Actions
      • Send message to customer | Responder | [message text, such as "Your estimated wait time is @wait_time_min-@wait_time_max mins."]
  6. Click Create.

Sending a follow-up message when a ticket is assigned to an agent

After you implement the estimated wait time trigger described above, you can create a trigger that sends another message to the customer when the ticket is assigned from a queue to an agent.

To send a message to an end user when a ticket is assigned to an agent

  1. In Admin Center, click Objects and rules in the sidebar, then select Business rules > Messaging triggers.
  2. Click Create trigger.
  3. Enter a name and brief description for your trigger.
  4. Click Activate this trigger.
  5. Customize the trigger as follows:
    • Run trigger: When a conversation is assigned from a queue.
    • Conditions: Match ALL of the following conditions:
      • Group | is | <group name>
      • Group status | <group name> | Online
    • Actions
      • Send message to customer | Responder | [message text, such as "An agent will be with you shortly."]
  6. Click Create.

articles.name: [CANCELLED] Scheduled Maintenance - October 14, 15 & 16, 2024 | Pods 13, 17, 18, 19, 20, 23, 25, 27, 28, 29 | Support (Agent Workspace Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.title: [CANCELLED] Scheduled Maintenance - October 14, 15 & 16, 2024 | Pods 13, 17, 18, 19, 20, 23, 25, 27, 28, 29 | Support (Agent Workspace Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.body:
Update: The maintenance windows listed in this article for pods 17, 18, 19, 20, 27 and 28 have been CANCELLED. Separately, pods 13, 23, 25 and 29 will be rescheduled for some time in November. We will send a new communication to notify customers with accounts on these remaining four pods at a later time.

---

Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for Agent Workspace Messaging customers on Pods 13, 17, 18, 19, 20, 23, 25, 27, 28, 29 during the times listed below.

Affected products: Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging)

Important: Agent Workspace improved messaging backend customers will be impacted, based on the Pod maintenance dates and timings below.
Customers Affected: Zendesk customers on the Agent Workspace improved messaging backend will experience a brief service disruption of up to 20 minutes at some time within the  maintenance window.

Date (UTC) POD Start Time End Time
Mon - Oct 14, 2024 17, 18, 28, 29 00:00 UTC  /
17:00 PDT (Sun Oct 13) 		03:00 UTC /
20:00 PDT (Sun Oct 13)
Mon - Oct 14, 2024 13, 19 06:00 UTC /
23:00 PDT (Sun Oct 13) 		08:00 UTC /
01:00 PDT
Tue - Oct 15, 2024 23, 27 06:00 UTC /
23:00 PDT (Mon Oct 14) 		08:00 UTC /
01:00 PDT
Tue - Oct 15, 2024 25 18:00 UTC /
11:00 PDT  		20:00 UTC /
13:00 PDT 
Wed - Oct 16, 2024 20 06:00 UTC /
23:00 PDT (Tue Oct 15) 		8:00 UTC /
01:00 PDT

Expected behavior:

During the maintenance window, customers may experience intermittent errors or degraded Messaging performance on all Messaging Channels for up to 20 minutes during the window, and agents may experience messaging delays or delayed ticket creation.

There is no data loss expected, and the service will resume seamlessly once the maintenance completes.

Outside of the specific windows outlined in the table above, customers should not experience any service impact.

What do customers have to do?

Customers are not required to take any action. Customers are recommended NOT to set ticket status to "CLOSED" for ongoing Messaging tickets that are open during the maintenance window so that any delayed messages can still be appended to the ticket after database maintenance is completed. If an ongoing messaging ticket is closed during the degraded performance window, messages not yet appended to the transcript could create another new ticket.

Why we're doing this: 

The Zendesk Messaging team is performing this maintenance work to improve the stability and scalability (storage capacity and general performance improvements) of datastores in the new Messaging Backend. This allows us to improve reliability and performance for existing and future customers to the new Messaging Backend.

articles.name: Why are CC recipients not added when forwarding an email?
articles.title: Why are CC recipients not added when forwarding an email?
articles.body:
Question

Why aren't CC recipients included in the ticket when forwarding an email?

Answer

Whether or not CC recipients are included when you forward an email to create a ticket depends on your Zendesk Support settings.

  • If you allow only registered users to submit tickets, CC recipients must be existing users in the system to be included.
  • To ensure CC recipients are always added to the ticket, configure Support to permit anyone to submit tickets.

For more details, see this article: Enabling anyone to submit tickets

articles.name: Service Incident - September 11th, 2024 - Guide | All Pods - 429 errors when submitting tickets in Help Center
articles.title: Service Incident - September 11th, 2024 - Guide | All Pods - 429 errors when submitting tickets in Help Center
articles.body:
SUMMARY

September 11, 2024 09:57 AM UTC | September 11, 2024 02:57 AM PT
We have received confirmations that customers are no longer experiencing 429 errors when trying to submit tickets via different methods in Zendesk. We are marking this as fully resolved now.

September 11, 2024 09:26 AM UTC | September 11, 2024 02:26 AM PT
We have rolled back a recent update that was causing 429 errors across all Pods. Please make sure to clear your cache and cookies to ensure you have the most updated version of the system available. Thank you for your ongoing patience.

September 11, 2024 09:19 AM UTC | September 11, 2024 02:19 AM PT
We’re currently investigating customer reports of 429 errors when accessing Support or submitting tickets via Help Center in Guide. More information to come.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Service Incident - September 11th, 2024 - Talk | All Pods - Unavailability to make or receive calls
articles.title: Service Incident - September 11th, 2024 - Talk | All Pods - Unavailability to make or receive calls
articles.body:
SUMMARY

September 11, 2024 04:10 AM UTC | September 10, 2024 09:10 PM PT
We are happy to report that the Talk call issues are now resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding while our teams worked through today's issue.

September 11, 2024 03:01 AM UTC | September 10, 2024 08:01 PM PT
We can confirm that Talk calls should now be completing successfully for our customers. We will continue to monitor and provide a final update upon full resolution. Thank you.

September 11, 2024 02:33 AM UTC | September 10, 2024 07:33 PM PT
Our Talk partner has identified a potential issue with the Voice SDK, and their engineers are actively working to resolve it. We have also begun to receive feedback on recovery. More details will be provided within the next 60 minutes.

September 11, 2024 02:03 AM UTC | September 10, 2024 07:03 PM PT
Our Talk partner has acknowledged an issue and are investigating further at their end. We are continuing to work with them and will provide an update in another 30 minutes or when more information becomes available.

September 11, 2024 01:41 AM UTC | September 10, 2024 06:41 PM PT
We are working with our Talk partner to investigate the issues impacting the ability to make or receive calls. We will provide another update in the next 30 minutes or if we have more to share.

September 11, 2024 01:20 AM UTC | September 10, 2024 06:20 PM PT
We are currently investigating issues with Talk calls across multiple regions. More information to come.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Service Incident - September 9th, 2024
articles.title: Service Incident - September 9th, 2024
articles.body:
SUMMARY

September 09, 2024 11:56 PM UTC | September 09, 2024 04:56 PM PT
We have confirmation that the deployed software fix has solved the issue that was affecting messaging via social channels. Many thanks for your patience as we got to this point.

September 09, 2024 11:20 PM UTC | September 09, 2024 04:20 PM PT
We are seeing recovery in our logs after a software fix had been deployed, and have successfully tested this as well. Please perform a hard refresh of your browser and let us know if the problem is still existing at your end.

September 09, 2024 10:53 PM UTC | September 09, 2024 03:53 PM PT
Our team continues to investigate the issue affecting outgoing messages in multiple Messaging channels powered by Sunshine Conversations. We will post further updates in one hour or as soon as we have a substantive update to share.

September 09, 2024 10:19 PM UTC | September 09, 2024 03:19 PM PT
We have confirmed an issue affecting messaging via social channels powered by Sunshine Conversations, causing some messages to not send to end-users. We will provide additional updates in 30 minutes or when we have new information to share.

September 09, 2024 10:06 PM UTC | September 09, 2024 03:06 PM PT
We are investigating reports of errors sending messages in Messaging channels powered via Sunshine Conversations, and our team is investigating. More information will be posted shortly.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.
